com.revature.jfbennatt.ers.controller.delegates

Class Delegate

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.revature.jfbennatt.ers.controller.delegates.Delegate
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    LoginDelegate, StaticDelegate, ViewDelegate

    public abstract class Delegate
extends java.lang.Object
    Root class for (most) of the delegates. The only method that should be called is processRequest(String, HttpServletRequest, HttpServletResponse) which authenticates the user and then (if authenticated) forwards to the abstract method processRequest(Employee, String, HttpServletRequest, HttpServletResponse) otherwise redirects to the login page.
    Author:
    Jared F Bennatt

      • setEmployeeService

        public void setEmployeeService(EmployeeService empService)

      • authenticateEmployee

        protected final Employee authenticateEmployee(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        Checks that this request is an authorized request. Returns null if the request is unauthorized. If the request is authorized, then this method will setup the response headers so that the client has the employee information (first and last name and token). The client should always grab the token because it may change. This method also handles a login attempt. If the token is not set (or is incorrect), then this method checks to see if an email and password are included in the request, if so it attempts to login said employee and returns an Employee object that has its fields set (particularly the token needed to subsequent accesses).
        Parameters:
        request - the HTTP request being made.
        Returns:
        The employee making the request or null if the request is unauthorized.

      • setNameCookies

        protected void setNameCookies(Employee employee,
                              javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        Sets the first and last name (unencrypted) cookie for the client. The cookies are set to expire when the browser is closed.
        Parameters:
        employee - Employee object to get the name from.
        response - HTTP response to add the cookies to.

      • setAuthorizationCookie

        protected static void setAuthorizationCookie(Employee employee,
                                             javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        Sets the cookie value (encrypted) for this employee so that the client can continue to access the server resources. The cookie is set to expire when the browser is closed.
        Parameters:
        employee - Employee object which holds a token to be set.
        response - The HTTP response to add the cookie to.

      • processRequest

        public void processRequest(java.lang.String path,
                           javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                           javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
                    throws java.io.IOException,
                           javax.servlet.ServletException
        Processes the given request by doing something with the response. This method is the entry-point to this class. It is the only method that should be called by an outside entity.
        Parameters:
        path - URI for this request.
        request - HTTP request being made.
        response - response to be given for this request.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        javax.servlet.ServletException

      • processRequest

        protected abstract void processRequest(Employee employee,
                                       java.lang.String path,
                                       javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                       javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
                                throws java.io.IOException,
                                       javax.servlet.ServletException
        This method should be implemented to add functionality to the processRequest(String, HttpServletRequest, HttpServletResponse) method. Sub-classes can assume that the Employee is non-null and is an authenticated employee (or manager).
        Parameters:
        employee - Employee object used to perform data retrievals (if necessary).
        path - URI for this request.
        request - HTTP request being made
        response - HTTP response to be returned.
        Throws:
        javax.servlet.ServletException
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        processRequest(String, HttpServletRequest, HttpServletResponse)
